And let us go<WH7725> back<WH7725> To our own people<WH5971> and our native<WH4138> land<WH776> Away from the sword<WH2719> of the oppressor.<WH3238>'

"As I live,<WH2416>" declares<WH5002> the King<WH4428> Whose name<WH8034> is the Lord<WH3068> of hosts,<WH6635> "Surely<WH3588> one shall come<WH935> [who looms up] like Tabor<WH8396> among the mountains,<WH2022> Or like Carmel<WH3760> by the sea.<WH3220>

"Make<WH6213> your baggage<WH3627> ready<WH6213> for exile,<WH1473> O daughter<WH1323> dwelling<WH3427> in Egypt,<WH4714> For Memphis<WH5297> will become<WH1961> a desolation;<WH8047> It will even be burned<WH3341> down<WH3341> [and] bereft<WH4480> <WH369> of inhabitants.<WH3427>
"Egypt<WH4714> is a pretty<WH3304> heifer,<WH5697> [But] a horsefly<WH7171> is coming<WH935> from the north<WH6828> â€“ it is coming!<WH935>

"Also<WH1571> her mercenaries<WH7917> in her midst<WH7130> Are like fattened<WH4770> calves,<WH5695> For even<WH1571> they too<WH1571> have turned<WH6437> back<WH6437> [and] have fled<WH5127> away together;<WH9191> They did not stand<WH5975> [their ground.] For the day<WH3117> of their calamity<WH343> has come<WH935> upon them, The time<WH6256> of their punishment.<WH6486>

For I shall make<WH6213> a full<WH3617> end<WH3617> of all<WH3605> the nations<WH1471> Where<WH834> <WH8033> I have driven<WH5080> you, Yet I shall not make<WH6213> a full<WH3617> end<WH3617> of you; But I shall correct<WH3256> you properly<WH4941> And by no<WH3808> means<WH5352> leave<WH5352> you unpunished.<WH5352>"
